# JaCoCo Method Filter Rules
# [jmf:1.0.0]
#
# This file defines patterns to exclude boilerplate methods from coverage reports.
# Methods matching these rules are annotated with @Generated, which JaCoCo ignores.

# ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
# COMMON JAVA BOILERPLATE
# ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

# Object methods - typically auto-generated by IDEs
example.*#equals(*)                     id:java-equals
example.*#hashCode(*)                   id:java-hashcode  
example.*#toString(*)                   id:java-tostring

# Getter methods - simple field accessors (starts with 'get')
example.*#get*(*)                       id:java-getter

# Setter methods - simple field mutators (starts with 'set', returns void)
example.*#set*(*) ret:V                 id:java-setter

# ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
# NOTES
# ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#
# Syntax: <package.Class>#<methodName>(<descriptor>) [flags] [predicates]
#
# Examples:
#   example.Person#getName()              - Matches getName() in Person
#   example.*#get*(*)                     - Matches all getters in example package
#   *#*(*) ret:V                          - Matches all void-returning methods
#   *#*(*) synthetic                      - Matches compiler-generated methods
#
# Predicates:
#   ret:V          - Returns void
#   ret:I          - Returns int
#   ret:L*;        - Returns any object type
#   id:<label>     - Label for logging
#
# Run 'mvn jacoco-method-filter:init-rules' to generate a comprehensive template.
